byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Nick Bilton, Julie Bosman, John Markoff, Nick Wingfield and Damon Darlin.

abstract: New biography of Steve Jobs, by Walter Isaacson, says Jobs veered from exotic diets to cutting-edge treatments in his last years as he fought the cancer that ultimately took his life; says his early decision to put off surgery and conventional treatments infuriated and distressed his family; book also includes previously unknown details of his personal life.
snippet: A 630-page biography on Steve Jobs also includes previously unknown details about his romantic life, his marriage, his relationship with his sister and his business dealings.
lead_paragraph: A 630-page biography on Steve Jobs also includes previously unknown details about his romantic life, his marriage, his relationship with his sister and his business dealings.
